body: Hello bugs and bees, I was studying HB with Mostapha's tutorials and met an obstacle which I couldn't resolve. The file I'm struggling with is described in [this tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nI8pkTBeye0&index=2&list=PLkjfDmSc5OryXkWSt57ltJFU4qXD5ss1v). Basically Run Daylight Simulation returns this message: 1. Solution exception:name 'exportAirWalls_' is not defined I don't get what's the problem here and what's the connection with Air Walls. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Z7Xreoa3jY3Pn6to0evC9onYkSpkCcJzQXzwyjyTDCFP4IYfuGG2TeTJdzK0C7ZbvGfhaW8pRq9l5yqLvCkdvL3NvxMoPSzN/Capture.PNG) FYI: I downloaded LB/HB from GitHub a couple of days ago.
topic: Run Daylight Simulation Problem ('exportAirWalls_' is not defined)

replies.body:
Hi Tim It's a micro bug, I'm going to fix it as soon as possible. Meanwhile, I suggest you do in this way: change the name of the input "exportinteriorWalls" to "**exportAirWalls_**". [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Z7Xreoa3jY25VXRhLCRijwkoOH8OuPtrs2bfX980o*1Ff2Df*aKOw9D3q*NsM2Fd3jToUUT6d0rv9ArgOAYiiw7xVf1HVqXE/fixtemporarelly.png) the simulation will run correctly and, although a new balloon message will appear, you will see the results.
I should ask Mostapha about this warning message (non planar vertices). [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Z7Xreoa3jY3ol43MNpCk4VSVdB5r-ToIxc2ICCYiS4tBuaJ9ca*j*nrjyTMaVdMvywrj81CqH7QmBtieSMXS7hNInqFuIv3M/fixtemporarelly01.png) best Antonello

You just need to reinsert the HB_runDaylightAnalysis. It is already fixed.

-A.

Hey Antonello and Abraham, Thanks for the care, yeah, I just tried to reinsert the component but now I have a new problem... [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Z7Xreoa3jY1jEC-zew*6FqbDQbi3WY-KcX2KMNE9Fb7kmBKfMSej6AQjd1TW2ydnF9NPN9zazcDT6IRtDRr*u4aUX7ZHo0F1/Capture.PNG) [](http://41.media.tumblr.com/3faa2018fb400bd3a87f179c136b914c/tumblr_n3dfwlPSL11rlo1q2o1_500.jpg) False alarm, but daaaaaaymn it took a lot of time to finish XD. Should I look more into RADParameters to tweak the quality? Does it work like Vray rendering? Thanks you guys.
